author: T_Lars
title: Another nice Creator set.
review:
I picked up this set the other day because I'm a fan of the Creator seiries AND of motorcycles, so how could I go wrong? Well, it didn't go wrong and this is a good looking, fun little set. I beleive it looks like a Triumph Street Triple with the twin headlights and the big, single side exhaust.  I'll be reviewing this set as the main model since the two alternate models looked a bit funky to me.

Pros

  • Good amount of detail (the engine looks like an engine, the seat looks like a seat, ect).
  • Very nifty suspension allows the rear swingarm to move.
  • Comes with a kick stand, which is a nice touch.
  • Cute little front fender.
  • Lots of orange!
  • It's a motorcycle!

Cons

  • The two alternate models just don't look all that great.
  • No front turn signals.
  • A little bit over priced, in my opinion.

All in all, this is a good set for all ages.  It makes a nice shelf or desk display for older Lego fans, and has tons of playability for the younger ones.  And since it's Lego, you can modify it any way that you want, so I replaced the orange "cheese" bricks on the front of the tank with transparent orange ones to give it some front turn signals.  It's not an expensive set, but I would have lowered the price buy a few dollars, it's pushing $20 and it's not very big.  Well, there it is; my first review.

author: Akceptor
title: Must-have Creator bike set
review:
Bought this set approx 2 weeks ago because of fun orange color (friend of mine has the same orange bike, but real one). The set is not very cheap, as for me, but it's only one bike in "Creator" series for many years, so must have.

Pros

  • Perfect main model design. Like a real bike!
  • Funny orange color.
  • Working elements like suspension and kick-stand.
  • Realistic lights in main model.

Cons

  • Alternate models are not so perfect.
  • A bit overpriced.

The main model design is very cool. The alternate model of chopper is funky, I really can not even imagine the orange chopper. Third model is fun, but nothing special.
